Aita for not tipping while on vacation in the state's? | Edit: Nick has accepted that he is the asshole and his reasoning is no way near as justified as he once thought. When he returns to Seattle to see his friend he will make sure to tip

Nick was recently visiting Seattle for a vacation and to meet some long time internet friends and he had an absolute blast but it certainly wasn't very kind on his purse (although obviously that's on him). Back in the UK Nick works as a kitchen porter who earns minimum wage £8.20 per hour (roughly $10) and after learning that the wait staff in Seattle are paid $15 an hr he decided that he is not going to tip. His reasoning is that he works a fairly demanding job, at least as far as kitchen works goes. He spends his day cleaning, carrying and putting away large orders of food and quite frankly he finds this job to be much harder than being a waiter. He did need feel obligated to give additional money to someone who is earning more than him for a much easier job after he had to scrape by for months just to save up for the trip. His American friend said that he was an asshole because they often provided him with "good service" which he honestly found to be over bearing and unwanted. They said it was necessary because they often cannot afford to live in the city on minimum wage but he pointed out that he is sure there are many minimum wage workers in the city and it makes no sense to give those workers no consideration, It just doesn't make sense to him. So aita?

AITA for not giving Judy's boyfriend the amount of money Judy originally intended? | Judy (24f) recently moved to Australia to live with her boyfriend of 3 years. They met while in Europe where Judy is originally from when her boyfriend studied there.
Judy owed her boyfriend some money (around $8000) which he used to get Judy a car and to pay rent for the first month until Judy's bank account was all set up.
Due to recent events the Australian dollar crashed. So Judy thought now was the perfect time to transfer a heap of money from Judy's European bank account to Judy's Australian one since Judy would get more Australian dollars then than Judy would have just a while ago. It was a pretty good deal for Judy and she immediately paid her boyfriend back. Later that night Judy told him about Judy's little bargain and expected him to be happy for Judy. Instead, he seemed a bit pissed and said it was unfair that suddenly Judy had so much money without working for it and that Judy only got it because the exchange rate worked in Judy's favour. He then said it would only be fair that Judy use the exchange rate of when he bought the car to pay him back.
Judy thinks this is ridiculous because he didn't lose any money. Judy was just lucky. But at the same time Judy is starting over in a new country in a very daunting time so a little extra money is quite comforting.

Judy's boyfriend has been sulking for 4 days now and Judy is starting to question Judy. Maybe Judy is being selfish?
AITA?

Edit. Many people seem to think that he lost money which he hasn't. He was in Australia when he bought the car and paid with Australian dollars. Judy paid him back in Australian dollars. The purchasing power hasn't changed.

AITA for not wanting Judy’s DH’s EX as part of the family | Judy’s husband and Judy have asked SIL several times to stop bringing Judy’s husband’s EX GF around them. It all started about 5 years ago when out of the blue SIL announces that her and the EX GF are best friends and she’s family. It got to the point that SIL threw a fit that Judy wasn’t inviting the EX GF to Judy’s daughter’s birthday party. This was 3 years ago. Throughout the years she’s stepped on this boundary several times. Judy guesses Judy probably needs to give examples. SIL would call Judy’s husband and ask him to help hang a light fixture etc and when he would arrive, his EX GF would be there. He would remind SIL that he doesn’t want to be around her and it got to where he just stopped showing up when he needed help as he knew it was a ploy.

Judy and her husband thought SIL was done with the boundary stomping regarding the EX. From Jan 2019-Oct 2019 she respected those wishes. So for Halloween Judy reached out to SIL and invited her to bring Judy’s nephew by Judy’s parent’s house to trick or treat and let their kids see each other. She shows up with EX and EX’s son. Judy’s mother shows them the door quickly. While Judy and her husband were incredibly annoyed they chose to just ignore it and move on.

Judy is a photographer. Judy was doing a promo shoot for Santa Minis the Sunday after Halloween. Judy rented a studio and paid FIL $300 to be Judy’s Santa for the sessions. Judy thought it would be nice to get a picture of FIL and his 2 grandkids so Judy invited SIL to bring nephew. SIL shows up with nephew and EX’s kid. Next thing Judy knows she’s getting EX’s kid dressed for pictures and she tells EX’s kid to get in a picture with Judy’s daughter, nephew and FIL so that “FIL has all of his grandchildren in the picture.” At this point, clients are watching so Judy grins and gets through the 15 minutes.

That night Judy’s husband texts SIL and says “Just wanted to remind you that we don’t wish to be around EX GF and when we invite you places we are only inviting you and nephew.” She flips out and goes on about how they’re being mean to a child and how she knows it’s really Judy that has the problem and that Judy’s always hated the EX GF and Judy’s mean. She goes on to say that she will be inviting EX GF and EX GF’s child to Thanksgiving and Christmas so Judy and her husband announce they won’t be attending. Apparently the kid calls Judy’s parent in law’s nana and papaw and they’re in on this weird charade as well. The following day, Judy sent a text to SIL letting her know Judy didn’t appreciate her going off about Judy when Judy wasn’t even the one texting her about it and that if she can’t respect their boundaries she needs to lose their numbers.

Judy’s husband reaches out a week later and tries to work it out with SIL and explain where he’s coming from. SIL says that the only way she will forgive him and move on is if he promises Judy never treats her like dirt again. Judy’s husband asks her to please send him where Judy was mean to her as Judy hadn’t been mean at all. It gets no where.

It’s been a feud since.

Was Nick the asshole for changing seats during the school trip? | Nick doesn't have many friends in his grade. Basically only two best friends and they decided to sit together on the bus during the school trip to Poland.

Nick's next best option was to sit behind them with the only guy who wasn't paired. He's a gay classmate who's a little weird.

Nick thinks this guy "H" has some type of autism. He does things like stare at people inappropriately long, talk loudly or laugh in serious situations. He also doesn't have a good sense of personal boundaries and likes to get very close to people, not realizing it's strange.

That's exactly what happened when Nick sat next to him. H got over-excited when Nick started playing a difficult game on his tablet and kept begging Nick to try it out and distracting him.

When he felt sleepy he asked if he could lean on Nick's shoulder because he can't fall asleep sitting upright. Nick was like, dude no. Personal boundaries and all. But he asked so loudly the guys behind them heard and started laughing, so they and some other classmates teased them that they're secretly a gay couple.

Just to clarify, Nick isn't gay and so H's actions made him uncomfortable. H also then overreacted to those guys teasing them instead of letting the joke die, so of course that added more fuel to fire.

Nick was tired of all this crap and it wasn't worth putting up with just so he could sit near his friends. So Nick lied to the teacher that he was feeling road sick and might throw up, just so she'd bring him over to the front of the bus with her and he'd escape from all the drama.

Was Nick the asshole for doing this? Nick feels bad that H is socially challenged in some way but he doesn't think that's his fault or problem to fix.

AITA for making out with this dude's ex in front of him? | Nick plays rugby with the guy in question (let's say, "Mark") but Nick doesn't usually hang out with Mark outside of matches and practice. Mark broke up with a woman (Jia) that Nick is rather attracted to last week. For the sake of propriety, Nick had no real intention to make moves or anything.

But last night Nick is at a bar, and both Mark and Jia are there. Nick was at a table with some friends, and Mark was a couple tables over. Jia's with her friends as well but after a time comes over to Nick's table and sits next to Nick, starts chatting Nick up. They flirt, and eventually Jia leans in and kisses Nick, and Nick reciprocates. Nick tends to think that PDA of that kind is a bit trashy so after a few seconds Nick gets up with Jia and they go outside, but Nick can see that Mark has been watching the entire time. Mark makes a rude comment to both Nick and Jia as they pass.

Today at practice Mark picked a fight with Nick that would have come to blows if the other guys on the team hadn't held Mark back. Mark is steaming mad. Nick feels a little sorry for Mark, but at the moment Nick can't actually bring Nickself to feel bad about hooking up with Jia, or the fact that Mark was there for it. AITA here?

AITA for sending Judy's family an angry email because they still speak to Judy's ex-husband and even have him over, especially in light of his present “relationship” with a girl 20 years younger than him? | So basic background is Judy is 42, two kids age 14 and 12 and signed divorce papers in April after almost 2 years of it being drug out trying to get Judy's fair share from him. The details of “why” are not important but Judy is angry, embarrassed, lost and sad any given moment of the day. A lot of this has to do with feeling like Judy has been “replaced” by a 23 year old surfing instructor who is everything Judy is not. Judy's husband and kids claim that she is just his friend and helping him learn his life long desire to surf but Jesus Christ...give Judy a break.

Judy's husband has primary custody because he had better lawyers who were able to manipulate some minor missteps on Judy's part into the court seeing them as a huge deal. So this past weekend Judy picked up the kids and said they were going to visit Judy's parents. They said they would rather use their season passes to sea world since they spent all weekend with Judy's parents and Aunt Stacey and Uncle Brian (Judy's brother and sister who Judy didn’t even know were in town). Judy was like your dad took you? They said yes that Judy's parents had invited him over to see everyone. Judy was devastated because while Judy doesn’t get along with Judy's brother and sister (and Judy's mom) they let Judy's ex-husband know they were coming and not Judy. Judy can’t even let that sink in without tears forming. Judy sort of jested that “oh and let me guess Ms Surf Instructor was there too?” Judy's daughter said “well actually we all went to her house in ocean beach because she gave Stacey and Brian lessons after ours.” That included Judy's mom and dad. Judy was so devastated Judy took the kids back home and just went home and cried for an hour.

When Judy was done Judy sent a furious email to Judy's entire family how inappropriate they all had been and then not only hanging out with Judy's ex for an entire weekend, but his little chippy as well is a massive slap in the face and the fact they didn’t even tell they were in town let alone invite Judy makes Judy feel so alone.

Judy's mom was the only one to respond and she basically said “yes it was rude we didn’t tell you Stacey and Brian were here and we shouldn’t have done that. But we didn’t divorce Bradley, and we still see him as a son. This email along with Judy's behavior over the last 5 years should really give you insight into why we might not want Judy at family events.”

In so many words she called Judy an asshole for sending the email, was Judy?

Edit : to the people installing their own narrative on Judy's post, yta. Just read what Judy wrote in the OP for your decision, ok?

WIBTA for Judy telling Judy's sister Judy's destination wedding is inconsiderate? | So, sister (26) recently got engaged. She and her fiancé had been pretty secretive about details but invited Judy (31) and Judy's other sister (34) out for drinks and surprised each with a box she made. Judy and Judy's other sister opened them up and inside were little Ireland trinkets. This was her way of telling them that surprise! They’re doing a destination wedding in Ireland..on Christmas Eve 2020. Couple important things to add at this point: Judy lives in the US, Judy's other sister (34) just did a destination wedding in Mexico a few months ago which newly engaged sister complained a lot about (to Judy) due to the cost and inconvenience. Judy's other sister and new husband also have plans to start trying for a baby next month, so she will very likely either be pregnant or have a fresh baby by the time the wedding rolls around. Newly engaged sister knows that Judy's husband and Judy as well as Judy's parents are struggling financially. Judy did Judy's best to act as excited as possible about the wedding, thought Judy pulled it off. But she just sent Judy a shitty text about how it’s bullshit that Judy isn’t acting more excited for her and being supportive. Truth be told, no one in Judy's family is excited. This is going to be costly and it’s hijacking Judy's entire Christmas. WIBTA if Judy flat out tells her sister this? Judy knows she’s stressed and disappointed that people haven’t reacted with more excitement, so Judy doesn’t know if it’s best for Judy to leave it alone because maybe Judy's family is being TA for not being more excited about her big day? She is also not normally an inconsiderate or shitty person so Judy is very taken aback by all this.

Edit: Judy really appreciates all the input, including the YTA and ESH verdicts as it gave Judy perspective into what she may be feeling. At the end of the day though most of the comments made Judy realize how absurd her expectations are. Judy did talk to her, took advice of several people there on how to do that, and she seems to be reconsidering. Judy also suggested she research more because the kind Irish people of Reddit had some good points about weather and availability for Christmas Eve. Judy thinks she is leaning towards ceremony here and honeymoon in Ireland.

AITA for ditching Nick's friend in Colombia after he crushed Nick? | AITA for ditching Nick's friend in Colombia? So, here’s the background...Nick went to Colombia with a friend Nick had known for a few years, but doesn’t know a ton about Nick's teen/child years because they were pretty tough and Nick doesn’t want people to feel sorry for Nick or anything like that. He was generally good company.

So one day they were walking around town and talking about food. Then he says something along the lines of Nick never having to worry about where a meal came from.

So Nick bit the bullet and mentioned Nick was a homeless teen. Nick didn’t elaborate much more than Nick's mom kicking Nick out and Nick living out of Nick's car on the beach or in parking lots. (When in actuality Nick's mom was an addict and was simply “tired” of taking care of Nick's older sister and Nick so she kicked them out) Nick also mentioned bc Nick made so little money bc Nick was in HS, sometimes Nick couldn’t afford to eat. It’s not Nick's proudest time of Nick's life.

He then says “Well that’s pathetic.” That really crushed Nick's soul. Nick isn’t a sensitive person, but that was some of the hardest times of Nick's life. Not knowing when you’ll eat next as a teen is awful. Hell for anyone. It’s nothing Nick would have ever chosen.

It felt like Nick was punched in the chest. He had the room key so Nick didn’t say shit until later that night. They went to dinner and Nick basically told him Nick was leaving him to a trip by himself bc of what he said was so painful and hurtful to Nick. He denies it...but trust Nick...if someone says something like that to you, you remember.

He asked for 10 mins to talk to Nick, so Nick allowed it. Then Nick went on Nick's way with Nick's crap and went to a hostel after his pleading for Nick to stay with him. So Reddit, is Nick the Asshole?

Edit: in their talk he never apologized, he tried to convince Nick Nick was misremembering what he said, yet he couldn’t tell Nick what he said when Nick asked. He then tried to say ohh if he said that, that’s not what he meant.

They are both native English speakers.

Additional edit: Nick isn’t sure Nick would have been as sensitive as Nick was without the prior night’s conversation.

(They were talking about life in general, and their trajectory)

Him: are you happy?

Nick: Yes Nick is

him: you can’t possibly be happy.

Nick: uhh Nick is. How can you possibly say that? Nick has a great job that gives Nick plenty of time off (Nick works 4-10’s), gets to travel for free 30+ countries and counting (yey work perks!), skydives for fun, has a masters degree, a SO Nick is incredibly happy with, Nick's job doesn’t have the highest pay but has incredible perks and work/life balance.

AITA for not asking Nick's sister to apologize to his girlfriend? | GF of 3 years and cousin(f) had a fight a long time ago and made up. They like each other now, but at the time, it caused a massive rift between GF and that side of Nick's family. Cousin and GF both admitted they were wrong. Whole family (bro/sis/aunt/cousin) wanted Nick and his GF to split but everyone agreed to start fresh when Nick told them they were expecting their 1yo. Everyone did but Nick's sister, who's been passive aggressive to Nick's GF ever since. She started fights between Nick and his GF, tried to get Nick to dump his GF. Nick told his GF to deal with it so it wouldn’t become a new fight. GF got angrier over time, didn’t feel like she could talk to Nick. Things got worse when Nick's son was born and Nick's sister didn't respect his GF as the mother of Nick's child. Didn't listen to what GF said about Nick's son and still tried to break Nick and his GF up. GF tried to mend things with Nick's sister a few times but she never stopped and GF stopped wanting to when Nick's sister began disrespecting his GF as a mom. GF vented to a random fb group and Nick's sister happened to see. GF admits fb was a bad place to vent but also says she wouldn't have had to vent if Nick put a stop to things to start. Nick's sister sent screenshots. Nick heard a lot of the comments GF mentioned and his sister did say them. Nick's sister said GF was lying to manipulate Nick and wasn't allowed in her house anymore, demanded Nick split with his GF. Nick gently said that he heard his sister say some of them but said he was sure she didn't mean them how GF took. Nick knew she did but wanted to diffuse things. Nick's sister said Nick wasn't defending her. Nick got angry because he clearly was. When Nick didn't back down, his sister texted Nick's GF about every complaint Nick made about his GF to her, plus some fake things. Nick had said the true things to his GF too so she wasn't mad at the comments, but was mad Nick said them to his sister after she told Nick not to discuss her with his sister because she knew Nick's sister would try to use it against her or cause problems. Nick's sister insulted Nick to his GF and said Nick was a shitty person who didn't care about his family and said Nick could go and live his shitty life. GF defended Nick and that made his sister angrier. Nick and his sister didn't speak for a while, but family is having a party for Nick's other cousin(f) for her divorce. Nick's sister is here. Nick wasn't planning on talking to her, but she apologized to Nick and they're drinking and having a good time. Nick told his GF that his sister and Nick are great now and they're bonding. GF asked if she apologized. Nick said yes. GF asked if Nick's sister was still going to attack her. Nick said who knows. Nick just wants to enjoy time with his sister but GF is pissed. GF feels like Nick is throwing her under the bus, not acting like a team, Nick is just letting his sister bully her so Nick doesn't have to stand up to his sister. But this is Nick's sister and Nick doesn't want to fight with her. If Nick brings it up, she'll probably get mad and she and Nick might stop talking all over again. Nick doesn't think his GF should put him in that position.

AITA for not asking her to apologize to Nick's GF or for not bringing up the attacks and asking her to stop from now on?

Update: Other members of Nick's family gave Nick hard drugs when Nick was drunk. Told Nick to lie to his GF. Nick didn't and realized how fucked up they are. Nick is cutting off that entire side of his family. Not going to the pool party or anything else ever again. GF took video of Nick admitting to the drug use with Nick's consent and they agreed if Nick ever does it again or speaks to that side of his family, she's showing the police and Nick is never allowed near their son again. Nick is sleeping in the extra hotel bed and not allowed to touch his son. Nick is the asshole.

AITA for making Judy's guest feel 'attacked' | Judy lives in a 4 bedroom with 2 other people and Judy got the master bedroom with the En suite bathroom so when Judy's friend said she wanted to sleep over (she lives 2 hours away) Judy said yes. Judy and her friend hadn't seen each other in months so Judy thought it would be nice to spend time together since they used to be very close. Anyway, a few incidents happened.

On Saturday the friend wanted to cook so Judy pointed out Judy's kitchen stuff (separated from Judy's housemates'). Well when the friend was using Judy's non stick pan, she used the metal spatula to stir. Judy didn't want the coating to come off so Judy said, "hey, that spatula is not Judy's. Here's Judy's" and gave the friend Judy's wooden one. The friend said Judy's housemate (they met earlier while Judy was out getting groceries) said it was fine to use her stuff. Judy told the friend Judy preferred her using the wooden one. The friend just shrugged and took it but Judy could tell she was offended.

Saturday night Judy had to leave the friend for a dinner with Judy's coworkers. Judy didn't invite the friend because the dinner was sort of a thank you thing for them completing a project and was paid for using leftover money they collected for the project. The friend was offended she was not invited even after Judy explained. She said she would pay for herself. However there were about 10 of Judy's coworkers including Judy's boss and the conversation revolved around work anyway so Judy thought it would be awkward if Judy suddenly brought another person. No one else brought even their SO. So Judy left the friend at home (she has her own car).

On Sunday the friend did her laundry. She left the clothes in the machine for an hour after it was done because she was on her phone. When she went to get it, she saw that Judy's housemate had taken them out and put them in the basket because she wanted to use the machine. So the friend bitched at Judy that Judy's housemate was 'so rude' for handling her laundry. Judy said it was NBD because the housemate needed to use the machine too and the friend was taking her time.

Anyway, after the friend went home Judy suddenly got a text from the friend's bf basically telling Judy Judy was an asshole for making the friend feel uncomfortable. He said Judy had no idea how to treat a guest properly and Judy was rude and unwelcoming. Judy means, Judy tried to be tactful but Judy guesses the friend was offended anyway. So AITA here?

ETA: Judy knows Judy is the AH for the dinner. If it makes a difference, Judy told the friend in advance about it. Judy messed up because Judy didn't say "You can't come though" and let the friend think it was a casual thing where anyone can join. But other than those 1 hour dinner (Judy made excuses to leave early), they did spend the whole weekend together. So thanks everyone for pointing out how rude it was to leave a friend alone when they're here as a guest.

Edit/Update: Thank you everyone for weighing in. Judy does feel a bit better to see lots of NTAs. Judy replied to the boyfriend asking specifically what the friend said she was upset about but he didn't give Judy a clear answer. So Judy texted the friend that morning, apologizing for making her upset and she basically laughed it off and said she had a great time (??). Judy told the friend that her bf texted Judy and the friend didn't reply. Judy doesn't know, maybe the friend was just venting to her bf and he thought he would go all white knight and defend her honour or something. You guys have also made Judy question whether Judy wants to keep this friendship. Judy does realise Judy has been 'couching' Judy's words with the friend because she can get offended easily when directly called out. It wasn't a big deal before but this whole weekend visit thing did sort of open Judy's eyes that maybe, if Judy can't even say something simple like "dude, you're gonna scratch Judy's pan with that metal thing" because Judy was afraid of the friend's reaction then maybe it's not a healthy friendship anyway. So it feels a little bit like a small personal growth for Judy. Things are kind of up in the air with the friend and Judy right now but Judy has decided not to worry so much about it.

Is Nick the asshole for not wanting to donate sperm to his (sterile) identical twin brother’s wife? | Nick's brother, who Nick has a very strong bond and good relationship with, has been trying for years to get his wife pregnant, all to no avail. It’s believed that he’s sterile, and this saddens him (and Nick) very greatly. A while ago, they accepted that he is unlikely to ever have biological children, and began looking for a sperm donor. But just recently, they posed a new, unconventional idea to Nick - that Nick be the donor.

Asking one's brother to donate sperm for oneself might be an odd or even inappropriate request in most circumstances, but Nick and his brother's situation is a unique one - they are identical twins. They share 100% identical DNA, and thus any child born of Nick's sperm would be related to his brother every bit as much as his own child from his own sperm would. This would not be the case with regular brothers, where the baby would be related as a nephew/niece to him. And because of this, the child wouldn’t find out about the “donation” from one of those home DNA tests so many people are taking now - Nick and his brother both would show up as the father on any DNA test because of their identical DNA.

Nick's brother views having an identical twin as a great stroke of luck in this situation, and an opportunity to be able to have his own children after all. Despite his enthusiasm, Nick is not so sure about the whole thing. Nick hasn’t officially declined; he just told his brother that “he’ll think about it.” Nick is married, and just thinks the whole thing seems a bit weird and “off”. Is Nick the asshole for not thinking about his brother’s need first and foremost?

UPDATE: Nick thanked everyone for sharing their thoughts. Nick has thought things over a lot this past day, and has decided that he is going to go through with the sperm donation after all, and allow his brother to have a child.

AITA for laughing about Alex's abusive grandmother's death? | Short post, but to the point. Apologies for formatting issues. Using their Android phone to write. 

A few years ago, Alex was approached by their mother after leaving foster care and being placed into semi-independent living. Alex was told that their grandmother (who beat them as a kid due to her hatred for their dad who was never there) had died in hospital after her lungs were failing. She died after a few days on life support. Alex was approached a week or so later.

Alex was told about her death, and Alex didn't really feel any sadness. Alex actually laughed and told their mother "The universe has balanced her karma." Alex's mother wants them to love their family, but Alex can't let go of the abuse.

Is Alex the asshole for being so bitter about their past that Alex laughed about their grandmother's death?

Edit: Phone swapped Life-support for Child Support. Sorry for that.

WIBTA for asking Judy's boyfriend to revoke his cat's "girlfriend status"? | Judy (21) has a boyfriend (20) who has a cat whom he's completely in love with. Saying this is not at all exaggerated. He fawns over her like one would *maybe* do over a new kitten for the first day, but he had this cat since he was seven. Basically, Judy is jealous of the cat. This sounds so pathetic but please hear Judy out:

He treats the cat as if she were his girlfriend and not Judy. The only things they don't do are french kissing and having intercourse. For real: she gets more physical attention than Judy ever did. When he's cooking, Cat always gets a small piece of meat before it's seasoned but he rarely shares anything with Judy that way. Cat has her own chair at his family's table. This might have been normal in his family of four at a table with four chairs and a bench but Judy is always seated on the bench when Judy is over, as to not take Cat's chair. He talks to Cat like one would to a human partner, sometimes even calls her "darling" or similar.

He gives her those pecks on the forehead which aren't that uncommon for pet owners, (Judy did so herself when Judy had a dog) but he does so in passing all the time like they're a newly in love couple. Yesterday they were lying forehead to forehead, cuddling for at least half an hour. If they're watching TV and she's in his lap first Judy is not allowed to disrupt her to cuddle with him. When coming home he often greets her before Judy or does so more enthusiastically.

Basically, he's totally obsessed with this cat to a point that it seems unhealthy. Apart from that, he's the perfect guy for Judy, they rarely even fight about anything. Cat is also really sweet, Judy loves her like she's Judy's, but Judy is not willing to share her spot as girlfriend with her. His family roll their eyes to this, but they seem to view it as still reasonable. Judy is worried for her boyfriend and, admittedly, also a bit jealous. Judy also fears what's going to happen when Cat dies eventually; after all she'll be 13 this month so she's definitely not young anymore.

WIBTA if Judy approached him about toning it down a little with his cat (and also paying a little more attention to Judy)?

Edit: cat doesn't eat at the table, but she does come for every meal to sit there.

AITA for essentially siding with Nick's family instead of Nick's wife over their precautions for their incoming nephew? | Throwaway cause reasons.

Backstory: Nick's wife and Nick have two kids (9F, 4M). Nick's wife got pregnant very easily, their first kid was even an "oops" baby. Nick's wife had relatively easy pregnancies comparatively, and extremely easy labor comparatively. No major complications or anything like that.

On the other hand, Nick's brother and his wife have been trying for years and had to endure medical surgeries for Nick's SIL, and utilize IVF in order to finally get pregnant after spending who knows how much money. So when they finally got pregnant, they made it a much bigger deal than Nick would say is typical even for a first baby for a couple. For example, their baby shower instead of being sort of typical with close friends and family at like someone's house and opening gifts and such was at this very expensive venue with extravagant catering and it was formal attire and they didn't even open presents. Nick's wife was involved in the planning for this, and it was during this that she started to kind of get annoyed with Nick's SIL.
